required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) With a Low Carbohydrate Diet to Reduce Weight in Patients With Pre-Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: Continuous Glucose Monitoring With a Low Carbohydrate Diet to Reduce Weight in Patients With Pre-Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will recruit pre-diabetic patients to see if continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) with a low carbohydrate diet can reduce the percentage of time the CGM readings are above the normal range. Through this study it will demonstrate the feasibility of using CGM with a low carbohydrate diet to reduce weight and risk of developing diabetes in patients with pre-diabetes.
Patients that appear to be eligible will be recruited from Michigan Medicine in the Family Medicine Clinic at the Livonia Center.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant Satisfaction With Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM)
primary_outcome.description: Satisfaction is measured using responses to the post intervention survey question, "How likely are you to recommend that a friend or family member with pre-diabetes wear a continuous glucose monitor (CGM)?". A 5 point scale was used, ranging from 1 to 5, where a score of 1 is "extremely likely" and 5 is "would not recommend". Satisfied respondents answered either 1 or 2 on the scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant Satisfaction With Continuous Glucose Monitoring
primary_outcome.description: Common qualitative themes related to participant satisfaction with CGM from post intervention interview were coded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of Pre-diabetic Patients to Wear CGM Sensors
secondary_outcome.description: Feasibility is measured by the number of participants who wore a sensor for at least 20 out of 22 days
Change between visit 1 and the final visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Percentage of Time Glucose is Above 140
secondary_outcome.description: Comparison between the first sensor wear period and the second sensor wear period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported Side Effects of Low Carbohydrate Eating and CGM at Health Check Phone Call
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 5 days each new sensor is placed (days 5 and 16)
secondary_outcome.description: During the health check phone call survey, participants were asked to report whether they experienced any side effects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported Side Effects of Low Carbohydrate Eating and CGM in Patient Log
secondary_outcome.description: In the patient side effect log, participants recorded whether they experienced any side effects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Knowledge of Low Carbohydrate Eating
secondary_outcome.description: The Low Carbohydrate Knowledge Scale ranges from 15-41, where 15 is a low score and 41 is a high score. Participants were asked to report knowledge at baseline and completion. A positive score indicates an increase from baseline in knowledge, while a score of 15 indicates no change and a negative score indicates a decrease in knowledge from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cravings From Day 11 to Day 22
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded cravings in food logs. Craving rating scale ranges from 1 to 5, where a score of 1 is low and a score of 5 is high.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intention to Continue Low Carbohydrate Eating
secondary_outcome.description: The completion survey asked participants a question, "How confident are you that you can maintain a low carbohydrate diet for the next 12 months?" Intention to Continue Low Carbohydrate eating used a scale of 1 to 5, where a score of 1 was not confident at all and a score of 5 was very confident.

secondary_outcome.measure: Utility of CGM Feedback for Changing Diet
secondary_outcome.description: Utility of CGM feedback is expressed as the number of participants who qualitatively indicated that CGM feedback helped them to change their diet. Themes were identified and coded from qualitative interviews around this topic. Two qualitative coders identified themes that supported this construct.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Normal Diet + CGM then low carb + CGM
arm_group.description: Phase I (part 1) - regular diet: Patients will wear a CGM sensor (with no real time feedback) for 11 days; document what they eat on a food log; and rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings. Phase II (part 2) - low carb diet: Patients will wear a CGM sensor (with real time feedback) for 11 days; document what they eat on a food log; and rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings; document their blood sugar before and two hours after eating (as well as before breakfast and before going to bed).

intervention.description: Phase I (regular diet): all participants will eat their normal diet and will log their food.
intervention.arm_group_label: Normal Diet + CGM then low carb + CGM

intervention.description: Phase II (low carb diet): participants will be asked to eat a low carb diet and log their food
intervention.arm_group_label: Normal Diet + CGM then low carb + CGM

intervention.intervention_name: CGM with no real time feedback
intervention.description: Phase I will collect CGM without real time feedback
intervention.arm_group_label: Normal Diet + CGM then low carb + CGM

intervention.description: Phase II participants will be asked to scan their sensor at least every eight hours and document their blood sugar before and two hours after eating as well as before breakfast and before going to bed.
intervention.arm_group_label: Normal Diet + CGM then low carb + CGM

intervention.description: Phase I: participants will be given the book Always Hungry and be asked to read chapters 1-5 after a health check phone call approximately 5 days after the sensor is placed. Phase II: participants will be taught about carbohydrates and the benefits and side effects. Additionally, they will be given multiple resources to assist them regarding carbohydrates as well as a book entitled "The Calorie King, Calories, Fat, and Carbohydrates." Groceries will also be delivered for 2 recipes that the participants choose from to make.
intervention.arm_group_label: Normal Diet + CGM then low carb + CGM

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- A1C Glucose Measurement between 5.7 to 6.4 (for most recent A1C test, not older than 1 year)
- No diabetes medication including Metformin
- BMI (body mass index) >30
- Must speak, read, and write in English
- No current pregnancy or breastfeeding
- Must not classify as either Vegan or Vegetarian
- Must be a patient at the Livonia Health Center
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous bariatric surgery

responsible_party.investigator_title: Dr Max and Buena Lichter Research Professor of Family Medicine, Assistant Chair, Department of Family Medicine and Professor of Family Medicine, Medical School

group.title: Normal Diet + CGM, Then Low Carb + CGM
group.description: For 11 days, patients will wear a CGM sensor (with no real time feedback), eat a regular diet, document what they eat on a food log and rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings. Then, for 11 days, patients will eat a low-carb diet, wear a CGM sensor (with real time feedback), document what they eat on a food log, rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings, and document their blood sugar before and two hours after eating (as well as before breakfast and before going to bed).

group.title: Normal Diet + CGM Then Low Carb + CGM
group.description: For 11 days, patients will wear a CGM sensor (with no real time feedback), eat a regular diet, document what they eat on a food log and rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings. Then, for 11 days, patients will eat a low-carb diet, wear a CGM sensor (with real time feedback), document what they eat on a food log, rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings, and document their blood sugar before and two hours after eating (as well as before breakfast and before going to bed).

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.description: The Low Carbohydrate Knowledge Scale ranges from 1 to 30, where 1 is a low score and 30 is a high score.
measure.population: One participant did not complete the baseline survey

outcome.title: Change in Knowledge of Low Carbohydrate Eating
outcome.description: The Low Carbohydrate Knowledge Scale ranges from 15-41, where 15 is a low score and 41 is a high score. Participants were asked to report knowledge at baseline and completion. A positive score indicates an increase from baseline in knowledge, while a score of 15 indicates no change and a negative score indicates a decrease in knowledge from baseline.
outcome.population: One participant did not complete the baseline survey, so change could not be assessed.

group.title: Normal Diet + CGM Then Low Carb + CGM
group.description: For 11 days, patients will wear a CGM sensor (with no real time feedback), eat a regular diet, document what they eat on a food log and rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings. Then, for 11 days, patients will eat a low-carb diet, wear a CGM sensor (with real time feedback), document what they eat on a food log, rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings, and document their blood sugar before and two hours after eating (as well as before breakfast and before going to bed).

measure.title: Change in Knowledge of Low Carbohydrate Eating
measure.description: The Low Carbohydrate Knowledge Scale ranges from 15-41, where 15 is a low score and 41 is a high score. Participants were asked to report knowledge at baseline and completion. A positive score indicates an increase from baseline in knowledge, while a score of 15 indicates no change and a negative score indicates a decrease in knowledge from baseline.
measure.population: One participant did not complete the baseline survey, so change could not be assessed.

outcome.title: Change in Cravings From Day 11 to Day 22
outcome.description: Participants recorded cravings in food logs. Craving rating scale ranges from 1 to 5, where a score of 1 is low and a score of 5 is high.
outcome.population: 10 participants submitted both pre- and post-intervention food logs. Data was unusable for 5 participants because they either did not complete the pre-intervention food log and/or they didn’t complete the post-intervention food log

group.title: Normal Diet + CGM Then Low Carb + CGM
group.description: For 11 days, patients will wear a CGM sensor (with no real time feedback), eat a regular diet, document what they eat on a food log and rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings. Then, for 11 days, patients will eat a low-carb diet, wear a CGM sensor (with real time feedback), document what they eat on a food log, rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings, and document their blood sugar before and two hours after eating (as well as before breakfast and before going to bed).

measure.description: Participants recorded cravings in food logs. Craving rating scale ranges from 1 to 5, where a score of 1 is low and a score of 5 is high.
measure.population: 10 participants submitted both pre- and post-intervention food logs. Data was unusable for 5 participants because they either did not complete the pre-intervention food log and/or they didn’t complete the post-intervention food log

outcome.title: Intention to Continue Low Carbohydrate Eating
outcome.description: The completion survey asked participants a question, "How confident are you that you can maintain a low carbohydrate diet for the next 12 months?" Intention to Continue Low Carbohydrate eating used a scale of 1 to 5, where a score of 1 was not confident at all and a score of 5 was very confident.

Intention to Continue Low Carbohydrate eating used a scale of 1 to 5, where a score of 1 was not confident at all and a score of 5 was very confident.

outcome.title: Utility of CGM Feedback for Changing Diet
outcome.description: Utility of CGM feedback is expressed as the number of participants who qualitatively indicated that CGM feedback helped them to change their diet. Themes were identified and coded from qualitative interviews around this topic. Two qualitative coders identified themes that supported this construct.

Themes were identified and coded from qualitative interviews around this topic. Two qualitative coders identified themes that supported this construct.

Then, for 11 days, patients will eat a low-carb diet, wear a CGM sensor (with real time feedback), document what they eat on a food log, rate their postprandial fatigue and cravings, and document their blood sugar before and two hours after eating (as well as before breakfast and before going to bed).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: This was a small pilot study to test feasibility of CGM. No statistical analysis was conducted because of the small sample size.
